meanings.definition: The quality or state of being instantaneous.
meanings.sent1: The instantaneities of the fireworks display amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the instantaneities of the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the instantaneities of his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of laughter in the room had the instantaneities of a surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The runner's speed had the instantaneities of a lightning strike.

meanings.definition: The occurrence or existence of something in an instant.
meanings.sent1: The instantaneities of the thunderstorm startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The photographer captured the instantaneities of the falling raindrop.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke had the instantaneities of a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent4: The news spread through the town with the instantaneities of a wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The car crash happened with the instantaneities of a flash of light.
